title: Sydney Thunder sign Lockie Ferguson, Sherfane Rutherford for BBL 2024
body:
A look at Ferguson's T20 career

Ferguson has an impressive track record in franchise cricket, having played in the Indian Premier League (IPL), Major League Cricket (MLC), the Vitality Blast, and the Hundred. In 42 T20Is, the express pacer has snapped up 61 wickets for New Zealand at a remarkable average of 17.72. Ferguson, who has been NZ's mainstay white-ball seamer, played for Royal Challengers Bengaluru in IPL 2024.

A look at Rutherford's T20 career

On the other hand, Rutherford has represented the West Indies in 21 T20Is, having slammed 362 runs at a strike-rate of 152.10. Overall, Rutherford owns 2,371 runs from 143 T20s at a strike-rate of 134.33. He is also a handy right-arm seamer. Like Ferguson, the Caribbean middle-order batter has represented a host of T20 franchises, including in the IPL.

Shai Hope to play for Hobart Hurricanes

title: ENG Vs SL, 2nd Test, Day 1 Match Preview, Dream11 Tips
body:
England is set to face Sri Lanka in the 2nd Test, Day 1 Match on August 29, 2024. The match will take place at Lord’s, London, starting at 03:30 PM IST. Both teams will be eager to start the series with a win, making this an exciting showdown.

ENG vs SL MATCH DETAILS:

England vs Sri Lanka, Test HEAD TO HEAD:

ALSO READ: Top 5 knocks of Major League Cricket 2024

ENG vs SL WEATHER REPORT:

Lord’s London Pitch Report:

The pitch at Lord’s, London usually helps both batsmen and bowlers but especially batters. Batsmen may do well early on, but fast bowlers could get more help as the game goes on. The match should be competitive if teams adjust to the pitch.

Match Performance:

England vs Sri Lanka PLAYING 11:

England (ENG): Daniel Lawrence, Ben Duckett, Ollie Pope (c), Joe Root, Harry Brook, Jamie Smith (wk), Chris Woakes, Gus Atkinson, Matthew Potts, Mark Wood, Shoaib Bashir

Sri Lanka (SL): Dimuth Karunaratne, Nishan Madushka, Kusal Mendis, Angelo Mathews, Dinesh Chandimal (wk), Dhananjaya de Silva (c), Kamindu Mendis, Prabath Jayasuriya, Asitha Fernando, Vishwa Fernando, Milan Priyanath Rathnayake

title: Pat Cummins Showed The Way Out ...
body:
San Francisco Unicorns vs Texas Super Kings, Challenger: San Francisco Unicorns have made it to the final of Major League Cricket 2024. In the final match, San Francisco defeated Faf du Plessis-led Texas Super Kings by 10 runs. Batting first, San Francisco Unicorns scored a huge score of 200 runs for the loss of 6 wickets in the stipulated 20 overs. In response, the Texas Super Kings team could only score 190 runs. Texas needed 18 runs in the last over to win but Pat Cummins gave only 7 runs and took his team to the final.

The Opening Pair Of Finn Allen And Jake Fraser McGurk Made A Brilliant Partnership

San Francisco Unicorns, who came out to bat first after losing the toss, had a great start. The opening pair of Finn Allen and Jake Fraser McGurk made a brilliant partnership of 79 runs in 7.1 overs for the first wicket. McGurk could only score 18 runs but Finn Allen scored a brilliant century. He played a brilliant innings of 101 runs with the help of 9 fours and 5 sixes in just 53 balls. Apart from him, Josh Inglis scored 37 runs in 25 balls and Hassan Khan scored an unbeaten 27 runs in 15 balls to take the team to 200. Noor Ahmad took 3 wickets.

Also Read: Most Runs In IPL 2024

Devon Conway And Joshua Tromp's Partnership Did Not Work

Texas Super Kings, who came out to chase the target, also had a great start. The opening pair of captain Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway shared a 55-run partnership in 4.2 overs for the first wicket. During this, Du Plessis scored 45 runs in 22 balls. However, the middle order of the team flopped and four wickets fell for 90 runs. There was a 100-run partnership for the 5th wicket between Devon Conway and Joshua Tromp, but despite this, the team did not win. Conway remained unbeaten on 62 off 38 balls and Joshua Tromp on 56 off 36 balls.

The team needed 18 runs to win in the last over but Pat Cummins bowled brilliantly and gave away only 7 runs. He did not allow a single four. Now San Francisco will face Washington Freedom in the final.

Also Read: After the cricket field, Harbhajan Singh's attitude was seen in the House, he raised his voice on important issues in Rajya Sabha; watch video

title: KKR Team Faces Another Defeat, ...
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas: In the sixth match of Major League Cricket, Seattle Orcas defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by 9 wickets. Batting first, the Los Angeles Knight Riders scored 168 runs for the loss of 5 wickets in the stipulated 20 overs. In reply, Seattle Orcas achieved this target in 19.5 overs by losing just one wicket. Ryan Rickelton scored a brilliant century for Seattle and Quinton de Kock also played a stormy innings.

Seattle Captain Heinrich Klaasen Won The Toss

Seattle captain Heinrich Klaasen won the toss and decided to bowl. Los Angeles Knight Riders, who came to bat first, did not have a good start. Captain Sunil Narine was out after scoring just 5 runs. After this, Unmukt Chand and Jason Roy took over the innings. Unmukt scored 18 runs off 21 balls and Jason Roy played a brilliant innings of 69 runs off 52 balls with the help of 5 fours and 4 sixes. In the lower order, David Miller also played a very explosive innings. He scored an unbeaten 44 runs off just 22 balls with the help of 5 fours and 2 sixes and took his team to a challenging score. For Seattle, Zaman Khan took 2 wickets for 24 runs in 4 overs.

Also Read: Most Runs In IPL 2024

Ryan Rickelton And Quinton de Kock's Explosive Batting Led The Team To Victory

Seattle Orcas, who came out to chase the target, also did not have a good start. Opener Nauman Anwar was out in the third over after scoring 9 runs off 7 balls. However, after this, two South African batsmen Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock together gave the team an easy victory. These two batsmen made an unbeaten partnership of 152 runs for the second wicket and took Seattle to the target in 19.5 overs.

Ryan Rickelton scored a brilliant century with his explosive batting. He played an unbeaten innings of 103 runs with the help of 9 fours and 5 sixes in just 66 balls. Quinton de Kock also scored an unbeaten 51 runs with the help of 3 fours and 2 sixes in 46 balls.

Also Read: South Africa Beats Pakistan Badly, Opener Hits An Explosive Century
